Articles.Content:
which kerbals do you prefer the most? With more stupidity or courage?? I prefer more stupidity.

stupidity+rockets=explosions!!

I prefer the ones I rescue from space.

They owe me a wookie life debt.

One that they will repay in full during an all too common rocket explosion no doubt.

1 minute ago, parv kerman said:

ok yea I agree you

I guess they had to be pretty stupid to get lost up in space in the first place though so...

I vote stupid kerbals!

I've always wondered if it even had an in-game effect. 

Are more stupid Kerbals more prone to misclicks for example?
The Kraken does not judge! All Kerbals are perfect sacrifices.

What about the greens ones? 

They seem pretty good.

green??

I think you are saying the normal ones.
I use my recruited veterans. Bill is the only orange suit I have left, so he chills on the station, with occasional visits to the Mun(station). He's banned from landings.
Stupid Kerbals are good for testing insane new stuff - for missions on tested hardware, a little courage is all it takes.

I always prefers Bill.

Since I regard him as another Anders.

The one I named after myself.

Though I'll take stupid pilots and engineers but the scientists have to have a low stupidity rating.
Don't mind. Any one that will go into one of my badly made rockets/space planes.
Diverse Kerbal Heads gave us "black" (dark-green), moustached Bob. Kinda Neil Tyson-ish. Love that dude so much.

I always tend to pick the Kerbals with highest Courage AND lowest Stupidity at the same time. Smart and brave Kerbals score higher on my selection flowchart. If I need more diversity, then I prefer low stupidity first, even if their courage isn't high, and lastly by extremely high courage alone.
I tend to keep Jeb around KSC as a test pilot. Beyond that, it's pretty much just making sure I have the right mix of pilots, engineers and scientists.
